SENT.plain: AIM: To assess the endoscopic activity before and after a one-year period of biological therapy and to evaluate the frequency of relapses and need for retreatment after stopping the biologicals in patients with Crohn's disease (CD) and ulcerative colitis (UC)
METHODS: The data from 41 patients with CD and 22 patients with UC were assessed
Twenty-four CD patients received infliximab, and 17 received adalimumab
The endoscopic severity of CD was quantified with the simplified endoscopic activity score for Crohn's disease in CD and with the Mayo endoscopic subscore in UC
RESULTS: Mucosal healing was achieved in 23 CD and 7 UC patients
Biological therapy had to be restarted in 78% of patients achieving complete mucosal healing with CD and in 100% of patients with UC
Neither clinical remission nor mucosal healing was associated with the time to restarting the biological therapy in either CD or UC
CONCLUSION: Mucosal healing did not predict sustained clinical remission in patients in whom the biological therapies had been stopped
